Animal¶

mod

biosim.animal provides the user information about the fauna on Rossumøya.

The different species on Rossumøya have certain characteristics in common, but also some differences. This script has all the characteristics for the Herbivores and Carnivores stored in superclasses and subclasses.

This file can be imported as a module and contains the following classes:

  • BaseAnimal - Superclass and the basic characteristics that all of the species in Rossumøya has in common.

  • Herbivore(BaseAnimal) - Subclass of BaseAnimal and characteristics for the Herbivore species.

  • Carnivore(BaseAnimal) - Subclass of BaseAnimal and characteristics for the Carnivore species.

Note

  • This script requires that numpy and numba are installed within the Python environment you are running this script in.

Superclass for animals in BioSim.

  • weight (float) – Initial weight

classmethod draw_birth_weight()[source]¶

Birth weight is drawn from a Gaussian distribution based on mean and standard deviation.

Returns

Birth weight

Return type

float

aging()[source]¶

At birth, each animal has age 0. Age increments by one each year.

weight_gain(food)[source]¶

When an animal eats an amount ‘food’ of fodder, its weight increases.

Parameters

food (int) – Amount of food eaten.

weight_loss()[source]¶

Every year, the weight of the animal decreases.

weight_loss_birth(weight_offspring)[source]¶

When an animal gives birth to an offspring, it loses weight.

Parameters

weight_offspring (float) – Weight of the offspring

prob_procreation(n)[source]¶

Animals can mate if there are at least two animals of the same species in a cell. Probability to give birth is given by the variable p which is calculated with the following formula.

\[\begin{equation} min(1, \gamma \times \Phi \times (N - 1)) \end{equation}\]
\[\begin{equation} \mbox { where } \gamma \mbox { is a constant, } \Phi \mbox { is fitness and } N \mbox { is the number of animals i a cell.} \end{equation}\]
Parameters

n (int) – Number of animals of the same species in a cell

Returns

Either 0 or 1

Return type

int

property fitness¶

The overall condition of an animal is described by its fitness, which is calculated based on age and weight with a call to the fitness_calculator function.

setter

Sets the fitness value

type

float

property prob_migration¶

Calculates the probability for an animal to migrate, based on fitness and availability of fodder in neighboring cells. Probability for moving is given by the variable p.

setter

Sets the probability value.

type

int

property prob_death¶

An animal dies with probability p based on its fitness.

Setter

Sets the probability value.

Type

int

prob_carnivore_kill(fitness_prey)[source]¶

Calculates the probability for a Carnivore to kill a Herbivore, and decides accordingly. The formula for calculating this probability is given below.

\[\begin{split}\begin{equation} p = \begin{cases} 0 & \mbox { if } \Phi_{carn} \leq \Phi_{herb} \\ \frac{\Phi_{carn} - \Phi_{herb}}{\Delta \Phi_{max}} & \mbox { if } 0 < \Phi_{carn} - \Phi_{herb < \Delta \Phi_{max}} \\ 0 & \mbox { otherwise } \end{cases} \quad \end{equation}\end{split}\]
\[\begin{split}\begin{equation} \mbox { where } \Phi_{carn} \mbox { is the fitness of the carnivore, } \Phi_{herb} \mbox { is the fitness of the herbivore and }\\ \Delta\Phi_{max} \mbox { is a constant.} \end{equation}\end{split}\]
Parameters

fitness_prey (float) – The fitness of the prey (Herbivore)

Returns

Either 0 or 1

Return type

int

biosim.animal.custom_binomial[source]¶

Function for drawing random numbers similar to numpy.random.binomial(n=1, p=p), but with built_in method random.uniform for faster code execution. Uses the numba.jit decorator.

param p

Probability

type p

float

return

Either 0 or 1

rtype

int

biosim.animal.fitness_calculator[source]¶

Uses the numba.jit decorator. Calculates fitness based on age and weight. The fitness is calculated by using the following formula.

\[\begin{split}\begin{equation} \Phi = \begin{cases} 0 & w \leq 0 \\ q^+(a, a_{\frac{1}{2}, \phi_{age}}) \times q^-(w, w_{\frac{1}{2}, \phi_{weight}}) & else \end{cases} \end{equation}\end{split}\]

where

\[\begin{equation} q^\pm(x, x_{\frac{1}{2}}, \phi) = \frac{1}{1 + e^{\pm \phi(x - x_{\frac{1}{2}})}} \end{equation}\]

Note that \(0 \leq \Phi \leq 1\).

param phi_age

Constant

type phi_age

float

param age

The age of the animal

type age

int

param a_half

Constant

type a_half

float

param phi_weight

Constant

type phi_weight

float

param weight

The weight of the animal

type weight

float

param w_half

Constant

type w_half

float

return

Calculated fitness

rtype

float
